extendedIngredients.name: kosher salt
extendedIngredients.original: Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper
extendedIngredients.originalName: Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper

title: Grilled Niçoise Tuna Steaks
summary: Grilled Niçoise Tuna Steaks might be just the main course you are searching for. One serving contains 444 calories, 53g of protein, and 22g of fat. This recipe serves 10. For $8.3 per serving, this recipe covers 41% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. It will be a hit at your The Fourth Of July event. It is a good option if you're following a caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal diet. Head to the store and pick up shallots, thyme leaves, ground fennel, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the kosher salt you could follow this main course with the Low Fat Crumbs Cake (Kosher-Dairy) as a dessert. 1 person found this recipe to be delicious and satisfying. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 45 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 89%, this dish is outstanding. Try Grilled Niçoise Tuna Steaks, Grilled Tuna Niçoise, and Grilled Tuna Nicoise for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Tuna works really well with Merlot, Pinot Noir, and rosé Wine. Though fish is often paired with white wine, 'meatier' fish like tuna can absolutely go with red wine. A Rosé will also pair nicely, particularly if your tunan is prepared with ingredients better suited to a white wine. The Pride Mountain Vineyards Merlot with a 4.4 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 50 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Pride Mountain Vineyards Merlot
productMatches.description: A sumptuous nose of bright plum, cherry, rose petal, mulberry and walnut introduces an enticing wine that sets the taste buds firing. The palate is layered and lush, expressing undulating waves of red fruit woven together by a rich mid-palate and vibrant acidity. 7% Cabernet Sauvignon from the volcanic Rim Rock block and the rocky Quartz Hill block were blended in to add depth and structure to the wine. While we often describe this Merlot as a "Cab lover's Merlot," the 2011 demonstrates what makes Merlot so lovely and special as a varietal wine – concentration, smooth but full texture, finesse and that elusive X factor that has "lusciousness."Blend: 93% Merlot and 7% Cabernet Sauvignon.

instructions: In a medium bowl, whisk the olive oil with the wine, mustard, thyme, fennel and shallots. Arrange the tuna steaks on a large rimmed baking sheet and pour the marinade over them. Turn the tuna steaks to coat. Let stand for 30 minutes.                                                                                                Light a grill or preheat a grill pan. Season the tuna steaks with salt and pepper. Grill over moderately high heat, turning once, for 4 minutes per side, until medium. Thinly slice the steaks, transfer to plates and serve.

steps.step: In a medium bowl, whisk the olive oil with the wine, mustard, thyme, fennel and shallots. Arrange the tuna steaks on a large rimmed baking sheet and pour the marinade over them. Turn the tuna steaks to coat.

Light a grill or preheat a grill pan. Season the tuna steaks with salt and pepper. Grill over moderately high heat, turning once, for 4 minutes per side, until medium. Thinly slice the steaks, transfer to plates and serve.
